comment: There are few things that I like about this app. Not "a few" ... "very few". First thing: I had the WORST time syncing things so that they would show up on my computer/desktop, from my phone. When I realised they weren't syncing, there were over 5000 photos to sync (I take a lot, and edit a lot). So then I try to sync them. For the life of me, I can't get them to sync over. So... I start searching. Seems like a few people (that I could find) had the same problem. The fix? I had to shut off my wi-fi, turn on the sync over data option, go back in, then it starts syncing, so I turn the wi-fi on again... it goes for about 250-350 photos... so I think... cool - it's working. NOPE. It goes back to the "preparing backup" spinning circle of death. So then I do the same thing. And it works again. Then it gets stuck again. So far I think I've done it about 12 or 15 times... and I still have over 2100 photos to do. So - THAT'S annoying. Second... I have to agree with someone else here, on their low review. WHY, when you delete a phone from Google Photos, does it delete on the stock photo app of the phone as well. Oh and I dislike the editing feature as well - it's very limited. But now maybe I'm just getting picky...
scenarios: Attempting to sync over 5000 photos from the phone to the computer/desktop. Initial attempts to sync do not work.
Searching online for solutions to the syncing issue and discovering that others have had the same problem.

Following a suggested fix: shutting off wi-fi, turning on the sync over data option, going back into the app, and starting the sync process. Then turning the wi-fi back on and observing partial success as the app syncs 250-350 photos before getting stuck again.
Repeating the above steps multiple times (12 or 15 times) to sync remaining photos but still having over 2100 photos left to sync.
Deleting a photo from Google Photos results in the photo being deleted from the stock photo app on the phone as well.
Using the editing feature in the app and finding it very limited.
key sentence: Deleting a photo from Google Photos results in the photo being deleted from the stock photo app on the phone as well.
